the Pentagon chief said, in effect, never mind. The three services, he announced, can decide for themselves how to prepare for the future.`` This is a big organization,'' he said. The services make lots of decisions. It would be foolhardy to try to micromanage from the top... every aspect of everything that is going on. If the review was overdue, the way Donald Rumsfeld went about doing it was downright peculiar. Instead of using active-duty officers to run the show, he at first went outside to retirees for advice.
